The Navy has proven time and again that the Red Hill Bulk Fuel Storage Facility is unsafe and must be shut down. I introduced H.R.6714, the Red Hill WAI Act, because every day we wait, we risk destroying O’ahu’s most precious resource—our water.

"The FAA believes the expansion of 5G and aviation will safely co-exist”. 

But then the FAA prohibited CAT II, CAT III, RNP procedures, auto land operations & the HUD when landing at 50 US airports where 5G is deployed. 🤷🏽‍♂️

This makes zero sense & is just not safe. https://t.co/F7CJNdky0H

It is winter. 

From snow, sea fog to zero vis conditions, starting tomorrow at SFO, JFK, Seattle & 47 other airports the @FAANews has prohibited airlines from using CAT II, CAT III or any auto ldg ops due to the 5G roll out. 

This makes zero sense & is just not safe. https://t.co/4PtlveVkp2

I agree. 

We must delay any 5G system from going live that is within the vicinity of any US airport. 

The inability to land at an airfield with low visibility & virtually render a critical onboard system unreliable below 5K feet is unacceptable & unsafe.

Why? No mandate. 

Time to define “fully vaccinated” as also including a booster for all eligible residents, on all islands & all incoming visitors to Hawaii.

@ChristinaJedra I do not have an official copy of the test results. However, those specific numbers of "residual petroleum products" were shared with the congressional delegation from the US Navy.

The Navy sample results from the Red Hill shaft before chlorination came back with 3 detections:
 
1.Xylene, 1.4 parts per billion (ppb) the threshold is 20 ppb
2.Napthalene, 3.8 ppb, the threshold is 17
3.TPHg (gasoline) 31 ppb, the threshold is 300
